p: These results suggest that A. nodosum communities are excellent bioindicators of climate change in the marine arctic, and that the estimation of tip growth of A. nodosum may be used as a relevant parameter in sub-arctic and arctic marine monitoring programmes. In fact, the Greenland Ecosystem Monitoring Programme 1 has already adopted A. nodosum tip growth as an important marine bioindicator of environmental change in the Nuuk area, West Greenland.
